Package maldiniPaone.servlets.managers.interfaces

Interface ManageAssignment

All Known Implementing Classes:
ReportManager
public interface ManageAssignment
This interface defines the signatures of the methods to retrieve the assignments and to update assignment state

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean acceptAssignment​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String username)
    Allows a User to accept an assignment
    java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> checkActive​(java.lang.String username)
    Check if there are active assignment for the authority
    java.util.List<Assignment> getAssignment​(Location location)
    Gets the list of assignment close to a given location
    boolean refuseAssignment​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String username)
    Allows a User to refuse an assignment
    boolean terminateAssignment​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String username, State finishState, ViolationType type)
    Allows a User to terminate an assignment

  • Method Details

    • getAssignment

      java.util.List<Assignment> getAssignment​(Location location) throws ServerSideDatabaseException, IllegalParameterException
      Gets the list of assignment close to a given location
      Parameters:
      location - the location to which respect the assignment are searched
      Returns:
      the list of Assignment found close to the given location
      Throws:
      ServerSideDatabaseException - when database can't be accessed
      IllegalParameterException - when provided parameters aren't valid

    • refuseAssignment

      boolean refuseAssignment​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String username) throws ServerSideDatabaseException, IllegalParameterException
      Allows a User to refuse an assignment
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the assignment to be refused
      username - the username of user who refuses the assignment
      Returns:
      true if it succeeds to refuse, false otherwise
      Throws:
      ServerSideDatabaseException - when database can't be accessed
      IllegalParameterException - when provided parameters aren't valid

    • acceptAssignment

      boolean acceptAssignment​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String username) throws ServerSideDatabaseException, IllegalParameterException
      Allows a User to accept an assignment
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the assignment to be accepted
      username - the username of user who accepts the assignment
      Returns:
      true if it succeeds to refuse, false otherwise
      Throws:
      ServerSideDatabaseException - when database can't be accessed
      IllegalParameterException - when provided parameters aren't valid

    • terminateAssignment

      boolean terminateAssignment​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String username, State finishState, ViolationType type) throws ServerSideDatabaseException, IllegalParameterException
      Allows a User to terminate an assignment
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the assignment to be terminated
      username - the username of user who terminates the assignment
      finishState - the status with which the assignment terminates
      type - the type of violation which is terminated
      Returns:
      true if it succeeds to terminate, false otherwise
      Throws:
      ServerSideDatabaseException - when database can't be accessed
      IllegalParameterException - when provided parameters aren't valid

    • checkActive

      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> checkActive​(java.lang.String username) throws ServerSideDatabaseException, IllegalParameterException
      Check if there are active assignment for the authority
      Parameters:
      username - : the user name of the authority
      Returns:
      list of the ids of active assignments
      Throws:
      ServerSideDatabaseException - when database can't be found
      IllegalParameterException - if parameters are not valid
